meanings.definition: The act of delaying or lingering.
meanings.sent1: Her tarriances at the store made us late for the movie.
meanings.sent2: The long line at the amusement park caused a tarriance.
meanings.sent3: His tarriances in the morning always make me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The tarriances of the snail were a lesson in patience.
meanings.sent5: The tarriances of the clouds painted a beautiful sunset.

meanings.definition: A period of waiting or delay.
meanings.sent1: The tarriances at the doctor's office can be frustrating.
meanings.sent2: During the tarriance, she read a book to pass the time.
meanings.sent3: The tarriance at the bus stop turned into a chat with a stranger.
meanings.sent4: The tarriance felt like an eternity in the hot sun.
meanings.sent5: The tarriance of the train departure was nerve-wracking.

meanings.sent1: Please do not tarriance any longer; we need to leave now.
meanings.sent2: He decided to tarriance his decision until he had more information.
meanings.sent3: She likes to tarriance before making important choices.
meanings.sent4: The chef will tarriance serving the dessert until after dinner.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students not to tarriance in completing their assignments.
